title: Topic 001 Question 221
body: A company is designing the security architecture for a global latency-sensitive web application it plans to deploy to AWS. A security engineer needs to configure a highly available and secure two-tier architecture. The security design must include controls to prevent common attacks such as DDoS, cross-site scripting, and
options: Create an Application Load Balancer (ALB) that uses public subnets across multiple Availability Zones within a single Region. Point the ALB to an Auto Scaling group with Amazon EC2 instances in private subnets across multiple Availability Zones within the same Region. Create an Amazon CloudFront distribution that uses the ALB as its origin. Create appropriate AWS WAF ACLs and enable them on the CloudFront distribution.
